title: Comparing Locations with a density plot
text: First, load ISD take quick look
code: library(soundscaper) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  data <- ISD head(data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 78 #>   LocationID SessionID   GroupID RecordID Language Lockdown start_time end_time #>   <chr>      <chr>       <chr>      <dbl> <chr>       <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 CamdenTown CamdenTown1 CT101        525 English         0     43587.   43587. #> 2 CamdenTown CamdenTown1 CT101        561 English         0     43587.   43587. #> 3 CamdenTown CamdenTown1 CT101        526 English         0     43587.   43587. #> 4 CamdenTown CamdenTown1 CT102        560 English         0     43587.   43587. #> 5 CamdenTown CamdenTown1 CT103        527 English         0     43587.   43587. #> 6 CamdenTown CamdenTown1 CT104        528 English         0     43587.   43588. #> # ℹ 70 more variables: latitude <dbl>, longitude <dbl>, Traffic <dbl>, #> #   Other <dbl>, Human <dbl>, Natural <dbl>, ISOPleasant <dbl>, #> #   ISOEventful <dbl>, pleasant <dbl>, chaotic <dbl>, vibrant <dbl>, #> #   uneventful <dbl>, calm <dbl>, annoying <dbl>, eventful <dbl>, #> #   monotonous <dbl>, Overall <dbl>, Appropriate <dbl>, loud <dbl>, #> #   sss04 <dbl>, sss05 <dbl>, who01 <dbl>, who02 <dbl>, who03 <dbl>, #> #   who04 <dbl>, who05 <dbl>, WHO_Sum <dbl>, Age <dbl>, Gender <chr>, …

title: Comparing Locations with a density plot
code: g <-ISOjointplot(filter(data, LocationID == "CamdenTown")) #> Warning: Removed 45 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_density2d()`). #> Removed 45 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_density2d()`). #> Warning: Removed 45 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`). g

title: Comparing Locations with a density plot
text: Now, want filter locations want investigate
code: cut.data <- data %>%     dplyr::filter(LocationID %in% c("CamdenTown", "PancrasLock", "RegentsParkJapan"))      head(cut.data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 78 #>   LocationID SessionID   GroupID RecordID Language Lockdown start_time end_time #>   <chr>      <chr>       <chr>      <dbl> <chr>       <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 CamdenTown CamdenTown1 CT101        525 English         0     43587.   43587. #> 2 CamdenTown CamdenTown1 CT101        561 English         0     43587.   43587. #> 3 CamdenTown CamdenTown1 CT101        526 English         0     43587.   43587. #> 4 CamdenTown CamdenTown1 CT102        560 English         0     43587.   43587. #> 5 CamdenTown CamdenTown1 CT103        527 English         0     43587.   43587. #> 6 CamdenTown CamdenTown1 CT104        528 English         0     43587.   43588. #> # ℹ 70 more variables: latitude <dbl>, longitude <dbl>, Traffic <dbl>, #> #   Other <dbl>, Human <dbl>, Natural <dbl>, ISOPleasant <dbl>, #> #   ISOEventful <dbl>, pleasant <dbl>, chaotic <dbl>, vibrant <dbl>, #> #   uneventful <dbl>, calm <dbl>, annoying <dbl>, eventful <dbl>, #> #   monotonous <dbl>, Overall <dbl>, Appropriate <dbl>, loud <dbl>, #> #   sss04 <dbl>, sss05 <dbl>, who01 <dbl>, who02 <dbl>, who03 <dbl>, #> #   who04 <dbl>, who05 <dbl>, WHO_Sum <dbl>, Age <dbl>, Gender <chr>, … g <- ISOjointplot(cut.data, group="LocationID") #> Warning: Removed 167 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_density2d()`). #> Removed 167 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_density2d()`). #> Warning: Removed 167 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`). g

code: @Manual{,   title = {soundscaper: Simple Soundscape Analysis and Visualisation},   author = {Andrew Mitchell},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/MitchellAcoustics/SoundscapeR, https://mitchellacoustics.github.io/SoundscapeR/}, }

title: Simple Soundscape Analysis and Visualisation
text: basic example shows load International Soundscape Database internet: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like :  ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.

text: Calculate projected ISOPleasant ISOEventful coordinates.

title: Calculate the projected ISOPleasant and ISOEventful coordinates. — iso_coords
code: iso_coords(df, scale_to_one = TRUE, val_range = c(1, 5), projection = TRUE)

title: Calculate the projected ISOPleasant and ISOEventful coordinates. — iso_coords
text: df Dataframe containing ISD formatted data scale_to_one coordinates scaled (-1, +1) val_range range values, default Likert scaled c(1, 5) projection Use trigonometric projection (cos(45)) term diagonal PAQs

title: Calculate the projected ISOPleasant and ISOEventful coordinates. — iso_coords
text: list 2 ISOPleasant ISOEventful values

title: Calculate the projected ISOPleasant and ISOEventful coordinates. — iso_coords
code: df <- tibble::tibble(   pleasant = c(2, 3, 4), chaotic = c(4, 4, 3), vibrant = c(3, 2, 3),   uneventful = c(2, 1, 2), calm = c(1, 1, 2), annoying = c(2, 4, 4),   eventful = c(4, 2, 3), monotonous = c(3, 4, 2) ) iso_coords(df, val_range = c(1, 5)) #> $pleasant #> [1] -0.2196699 -0.4696699  0.0000000 #>  #> $eventful #> [1] 0.4267767 0.1767767 0.2500000 #>
